editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALLÂ·E directed by Tim Burtonâ€”thatâ€™s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robotâ€™s quest for love combines tons more influencesâ€”like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic booksâ€”for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome â€œaha!â€ moments, itâ€™s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.

Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, itâ€™s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.

editorialNotes.standard: If you can doodle, you can play this one-of-a-kind Apple Design Award winner. Just draw a lineâ€”any lineâ€”and watch it spring to life across the screen, following your gestures to collect coloured dots and avoid black holes. But as the holes form increasingly elaborate obstacles, only the most ingenious doodles will do. With endless solutions to every challenge, itâ€™s a stylish, supremely satisfying test of your creativity and puzzle-solving prowess.

editorialNotes.standard: With all due respect to Batman, Sherlock Holmes, and Nancy Drew, Hercule Poirot might be our favorite fictional detective. Agatha Christieâ€™s dapper Belgian sleuth shines in this wonderfully well-produced adventure game, dripping with visual atmosphere and puzzles that require true deductive thinking. Outsmarting an uncooperative witness or piecing together a tricky clue had us bellowing a triumphant, â€œOui oui!â€

editorialNotes.standard: Now hereâ€™s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this seriesâ€”its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles and beautiful visualsâ€”while making masterful enhancements. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.

editorialNotes.standard: Mesmerising from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, youâ€™ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. Itâ€™s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwoâ€™s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldnâ€™t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beautyâ€”and this sequel didnâ€™t let us down. With its striking colours and level design, itâ€™s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what weâ€™ll remember most, thoughâ€”their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: An unforgettable adventure full of challenging puzzles and gorgeous visuals.
